intro: Stevia galeopsidifolia, commonly known as the Brazilian stevia, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is known for its leaves, which contain high levels of steviol glycosides, natural sweeteners used as a sugar substitute. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in temperate climates. Due to its medicinal and commercial value, it has gained attention in both traditional and modern herbal practices.
